sentences: Louise Augusta Marie Julia Haenel de Cronenthall (18 June 1836 – 9 March 1896) was a German composer who lived and worked in France.
Louise Haenel de Cronenthall was born in Naumburg, Germany, the daughter of piano maker Franz Julius Hänel (1804-1871), and moved to Paris to study at the Conservatoire at age 17.

She studied with  Alexandre Joseph Désiré Tariot (1803-1872) for music theory, Camille-Marie Stamaty (1811–1870) for piano, Auguste-Joseph Franchomme (1808–1884) for cello, and Jules Demersseman (1833–1866) for flute and composition.
In 1862 she married Léonce du Trousset, marquis d'Héricourt de Valincourt (1822-1889).
Haenel received a medal for her work in the Paris World Fair of 1867.
